meanings.definition: An animal that has strayed or wandered away from its owner.
meanings.sent1: The kind farmer helped the lost estrays find their way back home.
meanings.sent2: The shelter is full of estrays waiting to be reunited with their families.
meanings.sent3: The estrays played a game of hide-and-seek with the farmer, making him search all over the farm.
meanings.sent4: The estrays in the meadow seemed to dance with the wind, free from their usual constraints.
meanings.sent5: The children loved to visit the petting zoo and feed the adorable estrays.

meanings.definition: To stray or wander away from a usual or proper course.
meanings.sent1: The curious cat often estrays into the neighbor's garden to explore new scents.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to keep an eye on your dog so it doesn't estray too far from the hiking trail.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel estrays into the bird feeder, looking for a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts would often estray to memories of her childhood, lost in nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The river seemed to estray from its usual path, carving a new route through the valley.
